<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>

Another agent reported that the target code violated the Rule 17.8.
Here is the comment from the agent.
<violation scenario>
lfs_mkdir_ passes the address of its parameter 'path' (&path) to lfs_dir_find, and lfs_dir_find assigns to *path (updates the pointer to point into the path string). This causes the function parameter 'path' to be modified, violating Rule 17.8.
</violation scenario>

Your job is to insert logging code to capture the control flow and state information of the program.
Insert logging code so that other agents can reproduce and get evidence for the violation scenario.
<response format>
- test_code: a modified lfs_mkdir_ code that contains useful probe functions that print useful logs to a file "/tmp/logs/957.txt". The logs should contain the control path and state information of the violation scenario. If test code is not required to validate the scenario, you can leave this blank.
Here are the constraints for the test code:
- The test code MUST preserve the original logic of lfs_mkdir_ as much as possible.
You CAN just insert probe functions to the original code.
- DO NOT introduce new violations to demonstrate your scenario.
- The test code MUST be compilable and executable.
- The test code MUST include line breaks.
- You MUST NOT define the main function.
- You MUST NOT define macros.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_mkdir_:
```c
static int lfs_mkdir_(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path) {
    // deorphan if we haven't yet, needed at most once after poweron
    int err = lfs_fs_forceconsistency(lfs);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    struct lfs_mlist cwd;
    cwd.next = lfs->mlist;
    uint16_t id;
    err = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &cwd.m, &path, &id);
    if (!(err == LFS_ERR_NOENT && lfs_path_islast(path))) {
        return (err < 0) ? err : LFS_ERR_EXIST;
    }

    // check that name fits
    lfs_size_t nlen = lfs_path_namelen(path);
    if (nlen > lfs->name_max) {
        return LFS_ERR_NAMETOOLONG;
    }

    // build up new directory
    lfs_alloc_ckpoint(lfs);
    lfs_mdir_t dir;
    err = lfs_dir_alloc(lfs, &dir);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    // find end of list
    lfs_mdir_t pred = cwd.m;
    while (pred.split) {
        err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &pred, pred.tail);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }

    // setup dir
    lfs_pair_tole32(pred.tail);
    err = lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &dir, LFS_MKATTRS(
            {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_SOFTTAIL, 0x3ff, 8), pred.tail}));
    lfs_pair_fromle32(pred.tail);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    // current block not end of list?
    if (cwd.m.split) {
        // update tails, this creates a desync
        err = lfs_fs_preporphans(lfs, +1);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }

        // it's possible our predecessor has to be relocated, and if
        // our parent is our predecessor's predecessor, this could have
        // caused our parent to go out of date, fortunately we can hook
        // ourselves into littlefs to catch this
        cwd.type = 0;
        cwd.id = 0;
        lfs->mlist = &cwd;

        lfs_pair_tole32(dir.pair);
        err = lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &pred, LFS_MKATTRS(
                {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_SOFTTAIL, 0x3ff, 8), dir.pair}));
        lfs_pair_fromle32(dir.pair);
        if (err) {
            lfs->mlist = cwd.next;
            return err;
        }

        lfs->mlist = cwd.next;
        err = lfs_fs_preporphans(lfs, -1);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }

    // now insert into our parent block
    lfs_pair_tole32(dir.pair);
    err = lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &cwd.m, LFS_MKATTRS(
            {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_CREATE, id, 0), NULL},
            {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_DIR, id, nlen), path},
            {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_DIRSTRUCT, id, 8), dir.pair},
            {LFS_MKTAG_IF(!cwd.m.split,
                LFS_TYPE_SOFTTAIL, 0x3ff, 8), dir.pair}));
    lfs_pair_fromle32(dir.pair);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please provide the modified lfs_mkdir_ code.
